attributes.action: Stop the un-necessary development of a new Tesco superstore in the centre of St Albans
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Over time Tesco has acquired a site in St Albans that forms part of its land-bank of undeveloped land - on the former Eversheds print works (OS grid reference 152068), bordered by the north-east side of London Road (A1081).

St Albans already has a large Sainsbury’s, Morrisons, Waitrose, an Iceland, a Tesco Metro, a Tesco Express, and a Marks and Spencer food hall.  There is also a Sainsbury’s hypermarket, incorporating a larger Marks and Spencer food hall, 3½ miles away in London Colney.  There is local feeling that another supermarket is not necessary.

St Albans has been set tough Government targets to build more housing - some local residents believe that the Tesco site is more suited for hundreds of high density starter homes.  A city centre supermarket would make the already bad traffic congestion much worse.

Tesco's planning application was delayed because of delays over acquiring part of the London Road frontage. An application from Tesco is expected to be submitted.
